feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [tribalsystems/zenario] Zenario CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Zenario CMS v.9.4.59197 allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Page Layout.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44771
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ZenarioCMS--Stored-XSS---Page-Layout
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6cxv-27r2-fp3m

entry.title: [tribalsystems/zenario] Zenario CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Zenario CMS v.9.4.59197 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Organizer - Spare alias.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44770
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ZenarioCMS--Reflected-XSS---Organizer-Alias/blob/main/README.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mr4w-7vm9-cgqx

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the SEO - Extra from Page Settings.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44766
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---SEO
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-437p-jfm4-2387

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to Plural Handle of the Data Objects from System & Settings.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44765
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---Associations
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6xx7-r8x4-fpjp

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the SITE parameter from installation or in the Settings.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44764
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---Site_Installation
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j6h5-ggv2-3rfv

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Tags from Settings - Tags.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44762
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Reflected-XSS---Tags
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6fm3-r6mf-j875

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Multiple Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Forms of the Data objects.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44761
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---Forms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p4jj-gwpg-9jwh

entry.title: [showdoc/showdoc] Showdoc XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
ShowDoc v1.8.0 has XSS via a new page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16342
  • https://github.com/star7th/showdoc/issues/325
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2263-jwgm-wv97

entry.title: [showdoc/showdoc] Showdoc Forced Browsing
entry.content:
ShowDoc 2.4.1 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by navigating with a modified page_id, as demonstrated by reading note content, or discovering a username in the JSON data at a diff URL.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19609
  • https://github.com/CCCCCrash/POCs/tree/master/Web/showdoc/IncorrectAccessControl
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6xx7-cphv-pxgr

entry.title: [showdoc/showdoc] Showdoc CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
server/index.php?s=/api/teamMember/save in ShowDoc 2.4.2 has a CSRF that can add members to a team.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19621
  • https://github.com/CCCCCrash/POCs/tree/master/Web/showdoc/csrf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3p87-gqw8-4pf2

entry.title: [symfony/symfony] Symfony Session Fixation Vulnerability
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Security component in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.48, 2.8.x before 2.8.41, 3.3.x before 3.3.17, 3.4.x before 3.4.11, and 4.0.x before 4.0.11. A session fixation vulnerability within the "Guard" login feature may allow an attacker to impersonate a victim towards the web application if the session id value was previously known to the attacker.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11385
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00009.html
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/G4XNBMFW33H47O5TZGA7JYCVLDBCXAJV/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UBQK7JDXIELADIPGZIOUCZKMAJM5LSBW/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WU5N2TZFNGXDGMXMPP7LZCWTFLENF6WH/
  • https://symfony.com/blog/cve-2018-11385-session-fixation-issue-for-guard-authentication
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4262
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/194caff28b56707ea98e746c6582c06acbb9bc3f
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/fa5bf4b17d45ee32f41bd1a9abc3fb6c134ec89b
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/fad1e1f2ea336e85c889feece9d0e23fbfcf777d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g4rg-rw65-8hfg

entry.title: [symfony/symfony] Symfony Open Redirect
entry.content:
The security handlers in the Security component in Symfony in 2.7.x before 2.7.48, 2.8.x before 2.8.41, 3.3.x before 3.3.17, 3.4.x before 3.4.11, and 4.0.x before 4.0.11 have an Open redirect vulnerability when security.http_utils is inlined by a container. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-16652.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11408
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00009.html
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/G4XNBMFW33H47O5TZGA7JYCVLDBCXAJV/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UBQK7JDXIELADIPGZIOUCZKMAJM5LSBW/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WU5N2TZFNGXDGMXMPP7LZCWTFLENF6WH/
  • https://symfony.com/blog/cve-2018-11408-open-redirect-vulnerability-on-security-handlers
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/b20e83562e32c56f8d9b8296ab07b0e4c0a54db8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7hwc-2cq4-6x2w
